accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Use microfilm copies, Albemarle County, Reels 1-5.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Albemarle County Deed Books, 1761-1798. Albemarle County Reels 1-5, Local Government Records Collection, The Library of Virginia, Richmond, Virginia.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: These items came to the Library of Virginia in a transfer of court papers from Albemarle County.

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: Albemarle County was formed in 1744 from Goochland County. Parts of Louisa County were added in 1761 and 1838.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Deed Books, 1761-1798, of Albemarle County Court. The deed books record the name of the grantor and grantee, the county of residence of both individuals and a description of property being sold or transferred. All of the books have indexes.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Albemarle County is one of Virginia's Lost Records Localities. Additional Albemarle County Court Records may be found in the Virginia Lost Records Localities Collection at the Library of Virginia. Search the Lost Records Localities Database found at the Library of Virginia web site.
